title: Post-Pandemic Virtual Learning Environment Design: Language Collaborative Learning and Job-Linked Assessment Improvement

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational digital literacy, online learning experience, understanding of basic job-related vocabulary and grammar
context.additional_context: Customized virtual training design for job seekers and adult learners to improve occupation-linked language skills (negotiation, report writing, presentations). Focus on enhancing expressive competence, reading comprehension, and communication abilities.

learning_goals: Learners enhance peer evaluation and feedback skills using collaborative tools (discussion boards, co-editing documents) in mobile environments, particularly strengthening professional vocabulary usage and grammatical accuracy in business contexts.

In project-based assessments reflecting real-world job scenarios (e.g., business negotiations, report writing), learners submit results meeting over 80% of evaluation criteria (rubric) by utilizing three or more language skills (listening, speaking, writing, reading).

Learners design three communication strategies (e.g., active listening, clear expression, cultural sensitivity) for building instructor-learner trust in virtual environments (Zoom, Microsoft Teams, etc.), implement them at least twice weekly for four weeks, and achieve an average satisfaction score of 4 or higher on a 5-point participant feedback survey.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
